lead_paragraph: Louisiana State said Monday in a news release that quarterback Ryan Perrilloux had been suspended indefinitely for violating team rules. Perrilloux, who started two games last season — both victories — has been widely considered the successor to the starting quarterback Matt Flynn. But Coach Les Miles says Perrilloux’s status for spring practice, which starts Feb. 29, is uncertain.
